Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: The query string passed to 'MySqlCommand.MySqlCommand(string, MySqlConnection)' in 'StuReg.button1_Click(object, EventArgs)' could contain the following variables 'this.regDate.Text', 'this.fname.Text', 'this.mname.Text', 'this.lname.Text', 'this.gender.Text', 'this.dob.Text', 'this.category.Text', 'this.religion.Text', 'this.unrollno.Text'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

The query string passed to 'MySqlCommand.MySqlCommand(string, MySqlConnection)' in 'StuReg.button1_Click(object, EventArgs)' could contain the following variables 'this.unrollno.Text'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Rule.Name: COM visible type base types should be COM visible

Rule.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Rule.Name: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Rule.Description: A SQL command string built from user input is vulnerable to SQL injection attacks. Microsoft SQL Server and other database servers support stored procedures and parameterized SQL queries, which reduce the risk of injection attacks.
Rule.Resolution: The query string passed to {0} in {1} could contain the following variables {2}. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.
